attributes.action: make the day of the Eurovision Song Contest a national holiday, with obligatory fancy dress. Please?
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
If Gordon Brown is ‘for Britain’, then he is for making the Eurovision a national holiday (with compulsory fancy dress). Here are five reasons why (one for each decade the ‘Vision has been running): 

-	You can use it as a tool for improving citizenship education (how Europe works, who votes for whom and why. Watch out though, ‘cos some entrant countries aren’t actually in Europe)

-	You will reduce social inequalities by making everyone look equally ridiculous

-	You could aid progress towards 5-a-day targets by gifting all citizens a fruity vodka jelly (red, white and blue colours are non-compulsory but recommended)

-	You could enhance Anglo-Irish relations by bringing the joy of Terry Wogan to one and all (starting with a private audience chez moi – well as suggester of this policy I think I have earnt it!)

-	If you are behind it, we might have the chance of getting a half-decent entry (I personally favour Chas and Dave, see Facebook for further details)

Don’t let me down, Gord!

reasons: Intended to be humorous, or has no point about government policy
